content.text: I see there's a `git_backup_agent.js` file and a `git_backup.sh` script, as well as a `githubsync` directory. Let me look at the git_backup_agent.js file first:
Now let me check the git_backup.sh script:

#!/bin/bash

cd /home/ibr-ai-agent/.openclaw/

# Check if we're in a git repository
if ! git rev-parse --git-dir > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "Error: Not in a git repository"
    exit 1
fi

# Check if there are any changes to commit
if [[ -n $(git status --porcelain) ]]; then
    echo "Changes detected, performing backup commit..."
    
    # Remove any nested .git directories (convert submodules to regular directories)
    find . -mindepth 2 -name ".git" -type d ! -path "./.git/*" -exec rm -rf {} + 2>/dev/null
    
    # Add all changes (including new files and deletions)
    git add -A
    
    # Get current date and time for commit message
    datetime=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    
    # Commit with timestamp
    if git commit -m "Backup commit ${datetime}"; then
        echo "Committed changes at ${datetime}"
        
        # Push to main branch
        if git push origin main; then
            echo "Backup completed successfully at ${datetime}"
        else
            echo "Git push failed"
            
            # Get the error details
            error_details=$(git push origin main 2>&1)
            echo "ERROR: $error_details"
            
            exit 1
        fi
    else
        echo "Nothing to commit, working tree clean"
    fi
else
    echo "No changes to commit, skipping backup."
fi

content.text: Let me read the SKILL.md file in the githubsync directory:

---
name: githubsync
description: Syncs the codebase with github.
---

# Git Backup Agent Instructions

Run the git backup script at /home/ibr-ai-agent/.openclaw/ using the git_backup_agent.js file, follow these steps:

1. Execute the git_backup_agent.js file located at /home/ibr-ai-agent/.openclaw/workspace-githubsync/git_backup_agent.js
2. This script will:
   - Navigate to the /home/ibr-ai-agent/.openclaw/ directory
   - Check if there are any uncommitted changes
   - If there are changes:
     * Run `git add .`
     * Create a commit with the message "Backup commit {timestamp}"
     * Push to the main branch
   - If there are no changes, it will simply exit without committing
   - If any errors occur during the process, especially during git push, it will send a notification to Telegram with the error details

The script handles all the logic including error handling and notifications.
Perfect! Now I understand what I need to do. According to the instructions, I need to execute the git_backup_agent.js file to sync the codebase to GitHub. Let me run it:

Great! I've successfully synced the codebase to GitHub by running the git_backup_agent.js file as requested. The backup was completed successfully with the following details:

- Changes were detected in the repository
- A backup commit was created with the message "Backup commit 2026-02-06 11:36:30"
- 9 files were changed (36 insertions, 15 deletions)
- The changes were pushed to the main branch on GitHub
- The sync completed successfully

The GitHub repository at https://github.com/abhishekibr2/openclaw has been updated with the latest changes.
